message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with distributed storage systems and their security against wiretappers, which are topics related to information theory (cs.IT) and cryptography (cs.CR). The paper also discusses the tradeoff between storage and repair bandwidth, which is a fundamental problem in distributed systems (cs.DS). The paper's focus on exact repair and the development of novel information theoretic converse proofs suggest that it may also belong to the sub-categories of signal processing (cs.SI) and computational complexity (cs.CC).
